West Man United Roberto Mancini ready to replace under-pressure Slaven Bilic at West Ham 
Bilic has been under pressure after a poor start to life at the London Stadium with former Manchester City boss Roberto Mancini ready to return the Premier League By Warren Haughton Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WEST HAM could turn to Roberto Mancini if Slaven Bilic fails to arrest the clubs slide this season. 
The Italian was at the London Stadium on Wednesday evening to see his old side Manchester City brush aside the Hammers, and is keen on a return to England. Getty Images 4 Slaven Bilic is under pressure after a poor start to life at the London Stadium 
Mancini was also in attendance at the Emirates to see Arsenal lose to Watford 24 hours earlier, but his appearance in east London will be of more interest as the Hammers struggles continue lying 11th in the Premier League.

City were impressive again in London but the focus will now be on the Croat to galvanise the squad for the remainder of the season. ANSA Roberto Mancini could could retutn to Premier league with West Ham News Group Newspapers Ltd Mancini guided Manchester City to Premier League glory in 2012

The Mirror report the Hammers hierarchy will review Bilic’s position at the end of the campaign with just a year left on his contract. 
The club backed Bilic in the summer and in the January window with the additions of Robert Snodgrass and Jose Fonte. Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Chelsea v Arsenal 
And the poor start to the new era at the London Stadium seems to vindicate the boards decision to hold fire with a new long term deal, after a brilliant final season at Upton Park finishing seventh. 
The club are reported to be disappointed the new stadium has so far not provided the platform to move forward and challenge the big boys for the Champions League places.
